div.l: And forth she goth til she the cradel fond
She gropeth alwey forther with her hand
And fond the bed and thouȝt nouȝt but gode
Be cause that the cradel by it stode
And nist where she was for it was derke
But faire and wel she crepeth in to the clerk
And lith full stille and wold a cauȝt a slepe
Withynne a while this Iohn the Clerc vp lepe
And on this gode wif he leyeth on sore
So mery a fyt ne had she nouȝt ful yore
He priketh harde and depe as he were madde
This ioly lif han these ij clerkes lad
Till that the iij cok began to syng
Aleyn wex wery in the dawnyng
For he had swonken all the long niȝt
And seid farwel Malyne swete wiȝt
The day is come I may no lenger bide
But euermo wherso I go or ride
I am thine owne clerk so haue I sele
Now dere lemman qduod she go fare well
But or thou go o thing I wol the telle
Whan thou wendest homward by the melle
Riȝt at the entre of the dore behinde
Thou shalt a cake of half a busshel I fynde
That was I maked of thine owne mele
Which that I helpe my syre for to stele
And gode lemman̄ god the saue and kepe
And with that word almost he began to wepe
Aleyn vprist and thouȝt or that it dawe
I wol go crepen yn be my felawe
And fond the cradel with his hond anon̄
By god qduod he al wrong I haue mys goon̄
Myn hed is toty of my swink to niȝt
That maketh me that I goo nouȝt ariȝt
